title: [HUDI-7718] Use source profile in HoodieIncrSource
body:
### Change Logs

Similar to KafkaSource, the source profile populated in StreamContext can be used for better parallelism and instead of using a static value for numInstantsPerFetch, a dynamic value generated based on heuristics can be used. This PR needs to be merged after [https://github.com/https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/10918]

Try to fetch the latestSourceProfile always, this ensures the profile is refreshed if it's no longer valid. The implementation of source profile takes care when a profile needs to be refreshed or re-computed again.

### Impact

A new constructor added for HoodieIncrSource for emitting metrics related to source parallelism and source bytes ingested.


### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

Medium

### Documentation Update

None.

title: [HUDI-7725] Restructure HFileBootstrapIndex to separate Hadoop-dependent logic
body:
### Change Logs
need https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/11163 to land first
Restructure HFileBootstrapIndex to separate Hadoop-dependent logic

hudi-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/HFileBootstrapIndex.java
is split up into:
hudi-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/hfile/HFileBootstrapIndex.java
hudi-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/hfile/HFileBootstrapIndexReader.java
hudi-hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/hfile/HBaseHFileBootstrapIndexReader.java
hudi-hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/hfile/HBaseHFileBootstrapIndexWriter.java
and hudi-hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/bootstrap/index/HFileBootstrapIndex.java

Also moved SeekableByteArrayInputStream from 
hudi-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/io/storage/HoodieAvroHFileReaderImplBase.java
to hudi-hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/io/hadoop/HoodieHFileUtils.java

removing hadoop dep from hudi common

title: [HUDI-7710] Use compaction.requested during conflict resolution
body:
### Change Logs

During conflict resolution between an ingestion writer and a compaction operation, if the compaction is in `inflight` state, Hudi extracts a NULL compaction plan from this `inflight` file since there is no compaction plan stored there, which further causes NPE.

Therefore, during conflict resolution, we should replace `compaction.inflight` instant with `compaction.requested` instant.
### Impact

Fixed a bug.

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

Low.

title: [HUDI-7699] Support STS external ids and configurable session names in the AWS StsAssumeRoleCredentialsProvider
body:
### Change Logs

See issue [HUDI-7699](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-7699).

[HUDI-6695](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-6695) (#9260) added a AWS credentials provider to support assuming a role when syncing to Glue.

We use Hudi in a multi-tenant environment, and our customers give us delegated access to their Glue catalog.  In this multi-tenant setup it is important to use [an external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) to improve security when assuming IAM roles.

Furthermore, the STS session name is currently hard-coded to "hoodie".  It is helpful for us to have configurable session names so we have better tracability of what entities are creating STS sessions in the cloud.

Currently, the assumed role is configured with the `hoodie.aws.role.arn` config property.  I would like to add the following extra optional config properties, which will be used by the `HoodieConfigAWSAssumedRoleCredentialsProvider`:

- `hoodie.aws.role.external.id`
- `hoodie.aws.role.session.name`


### Impact

No impact to any existing way of using Hudi.  It only adds more configurability to an existing feature.

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

Low

### Documentation Update

None.  The new configuration options need to be documented, but I believe that is done automatically from the config code (someone please confirm this!)

### Contributor's checklist

- [ ] Read through [contributor's guide](https://hudi.apache.org/contribute/how-to-contribute)
- [ ] Change Logs and Impact were stated clearly
- [ ] Adequate tests were added if applicable

title: [HUDI-6296] Add Scala 2.13 support for Spark 3.5 integration
body:
### Change Logs

This PR adds Scala 2.13 support for Spark 3.5 integration:
- Adds `scala-2.13` profile to support building Spark-related modules, i.e., `hudi-spark-bundle`, `hudi-utilities-bundle`, and `hudi-utilities-slim-bundle`, with Scala 2.13.
- Changes `hudi-spark3.5.x` module to support Scala 2.13 so that Hudi Spark 3.5 integration with Scala 2.13 is supported, besides Scala 2.12.
- Makes changes to Java and Scala code around conversion between Java and Scala collections, since Scala 2.13 makes several source-incompatible changes on collections (see https://docs.scala-lang.org/overviews/core/collections-migration-213.html).  The code changes are made in a way that the code can be compiled for all three Scala versions, i.e., Scala 2.11, 2.12, and 2.13.
  - Creates a new Scala object, `JavaScalaConverters,` containing a few Scala conversion utils. This object can be conveniently used by Java classes to avoid code redundancy instead of directly using `scala.collection.JavaConverters`.
  - Consistently imports [`scala.collection.JavaConverters._`](https://www.scala-lang.org/api/2.13.x/scala/collection/JavaConverters$.html) in Scala code for classes that need conversion between Java and Scala collections.  The conversion logic is explicit now, i.e., explicitly calling `.asScala` or `.asJava`, instead of implicit conversion with `scala.collection.JavaConversions._`.  Note that the logic is the same between `JavaConverters` and `JavaConversions`, so there is no logic change using explicit conversion calls.
    - for example: `scalaCollection.javaCollectionApi` (implicit) -> `scalaCollection.asJava.javaCollectionApi` (explicit), `javaCollection.scalaCollectionApi` (implicit) -> `javaCollection.asScala.scalaCollectionApi` (explicit)
  - Adds `toSeq` when immutable `Seq` is required as the argument type in Scala 2.13.  This is a no-op when compiled against Scala 2.12, and conversion to immutable `Seq` in Scala 2.13.  This is because, in Scala 2.13, `scala.Seq[+A]` is now an alias for `scala.collection.immutable.Seq[A]` (instead of `scala.collection.Seq[A]`) (see https://docs.scala-lang.org/overviews/core/collections-migration-213.html).
  - Uses `scalaMap.getOrElse` to get config value instead of relying on conversion like `scalaMap.asJava.getOrDefault`.
  - Directly uses language-native APIs when possible to avoid conversion between Scala and Java collections.
  - Fixes code that does not compile in Scala 2.13.
  - In `SpaceCurveSortingHelper#appendToRow`, the existing hack no longer works for Scala 2.13, so uses `Object[] currentValues = JavaScalaConverters.convertScalaListToJavaList(row.toSeq()).toArray();` to replace `Object[] currentValues = (Object[]) ((WrappedArray<Object>) row.toSeq()).array();`.  This only affects Z-Order or Hilbert space curve in Hudi clustering.
- Adds CI tasks on running tests on Spark 3.5 and Scala 2.13
  - Add Spark 3.5 and Scala 2.13 test profiles in `test-spark-java-tests`, `test-spark-scala-tests`, `test-spark-java17-java-tests`, `test-spark-java17-scala-tests`, `docker-java17-test`, and `validate-bundles` in GitHub CI.  The `scala-2.13` profile is validated with Spark 3.5 and the Hudi Spark 3.5 integration and `hudi-spark3.5-bundle` for Scala 2.13 are extensively tested in CI.
  - Adjusts Dockerfile (`packaging/bundle-validation/base/Dockerfile`) of bundle validation image and adds a script to build the image for Spark 3.5 and Scala 2.13 (`packaging/bundle-validation/base/build_flink1180hive313spark350scala213.sh`).  The image is uploaded to the Docker Hub as `apachehudi/hudi-ci-bundle-validation-base:flink1180hive313spark350scala213`.
  - Updates bundle validation scripts for GitHub CI.
- Updates `README.md` to include Scala 2.13 build process.

### Impact

Adds support for Hudi on Spark 3.5 with Scala 2.13.

### Risk level

low

### Documentation Update

`README.md` is updated to include Scala 2.13 build process.  HUDI-7695 to track the website docs update.

title: [HUDI-7673] Fixing false positive validation failure for RLI with MDT validation tool
body:
### Change Logs

Fixing false positive validation failure for RLI with MDT validation tool. 
When FS based record key locations are polled, we could have a pending commit. and when MDT is polled or record locations, the commit could have been completed. And so, rli validation could return additional record locations.

### Impact

Robust RLI validation with MDT validator tool.

This PR fixes the bug that subclasses implementing `StorageConfiguration` cannot be properly (de)serialized in Spark. A new test is added, which fails without the fix and passes with the fix.

title: [HUDI-7652] Add new `HoodieMergeKey` API to support simple and composite keys
body:
### Change Logs

This PR introduces a new class hierarchy for handling merge keys in a more flexible and decoupled manner. It adds the `HoodieMergeKey` interface, along with two implementations: `HoodieSimpleMergeKey` and `HoodieCompositeMergeKey`. This design allows us to extend key-based merge strategies easily.

**Motivation**

The need for introducing a new merge key handling mechanism was driven by the requirement to support different types of keys (simple and complex) without overloading the existing HoodieKey class, which is central to the write path. By segregating merge key handling into its own hierarchy, we avoid potential conflicts and keep modifications localised, improving the maintainability of the code.

**Changes**

1. `HoodieMergeKey`: New API to ensure consistent handling including simple keys and composite keys. It includes methods for retrieving the key and partition path.
2. `HoodieSimpleMergeKey`: Wraps `HoodieKey` and implements the `HoodieMergeKey` interface for simple scenarios where the key is a string.
3. `HoodieCompositeMergeKey`: Implements the  `HoodieMergeKey` interface but allows for complex types as keys, enhancing flexibility for scenarios where a simple string key is not sufficient.
4. `HoodieMergeKeyBasedRecordMerger`: A new implementation of `HoodieRecordMerger` based on `HoodieMergeKey`. If the merge keys are of type `HoodieCompositeMergeKey`, then it returns the older and newer records. Otherwise, it calls the merge method from the parent class.
5. `HoodieMergedLogRecordScanner`: Changes to merge based on `HoodieMergeKey`.
6. Unit tests for the new merger.

These changes do not affect existing functionalities that do not rely on merge keys. It introduces additional classes that are used explicitly for new functionalities involving various key types in merging operations. This ensures minimal to no risk for existing processes.

### Impact

Enhancing the flexibility and robustness of our key-based merge strategies. It helps in keeping our codebase scalable and maintainable, allowing easy extensions and modifications in the future.

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

title: [HUDI-7653] Refactor HoodieFileIndex for more flexibility
body:
### Change Logs

Task: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-7639  

Created new abstract class SparkBaseIndexSupport with abstract methods `getIndexName`, `isIndexAvailable`, `computeCandidateFileNames` and `invalidateCaches` (to override it in descendants) and concrete methods `getPrunedFileNames`, `getCandidateFiles` and `shouldReadInMemory` (moved from HoodieFileIndex or XXXIndexSupport to reuse it in descendants).

Made `ColumnStatsIndexSupport`, `FunctionalIndexSupport` and `RecordLevelIndexSupport` classes extend `SparkBaseIndexSupport`. Implementation of `computeCandidateFileNames` was made from corresponding if-else branches of `HoodieFileIndex.lookupCandidateFilesInMetadataTable()`. Implementations of  `getIndexName`, `isIndexAvailable` are trivial. Real implementation of `invalidateCaches` exists only for `ColumnStatsIndexSupport`.

Replaced 3 individual XXXIndexSupport fields with one list of 3 SparkBaseIndexSupport items. The order of items is important: to preserve original behavior the order of indices must be: RecordLevel, Functional, ColStats.   

`HoodieFileIndex.lookupCandidateFilesInMetadataTable()` is simplified to just looping through the list, checking each Index availability and (if so) computing pruned file names by XXXIndexSupport class.

### Impact

title: [HUDI-4732] Add support for confluent schema registry with proto
body:
### Change Logs

- Adds support for deserializing with the Confluent proto deserializer
- Adds convert to convert response from SchemaRegistryProvider to Avro for Proto topics
- Updates testing for these cases

### Impact

Allows users currently using Confluent + Proto to integrate with the Hudi Streamer more easily

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

None

title: [HUDI-7648] Refactor MetadataPartitionType so as to enahance reuse
body:
### Change Logs

- MetadataPartitionType` now includes predicates for checking both the enabling condition based on metadata configuration and metaClient.
- Move the `HoodieBackedTableMetadataWriter::enablePartitions` method as a static method inside the enum itself.
- Add test for the enum.

### Impact

Enhance reuse and ease of adding new metadata partitions (indexes).
